business.headline: Centre approves Madhya Pradesh's request for soybean procurement at MSPUnion Agriculture and Farmer Welfare Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan confirmed that the proposal from the Madhya Pradesh government was received and approved late Tuesday.

Centre lifts minimum export price cap on onion, basmati riceThe $950 per tonne minimum export price for basmati rice has been removed while the export duty on onion has been cut to 20 per cent from 40 per cent, in effect from September 14.

Bajaj Housing Finance IPO: Will it double investors' wealth on market debut?Bajaj Housing Finance IPO listing: With the GMP indicating a significant upside, all eyes are now on whether the shares will live up to the hype and deliver the bumper listing gains many expect.

Trump allies plan to privatise Fannie and Freddie, says reportThe discussions involve prominent figures close to Trump, including Larry Kudlow, the former director of the National Economic Council, and John McEntee, who previously worked in the White House.

Sebi chief addresses conflict of interest allegations with 3 big clarificationsThe Buchs firmly denied any wrongdoing, offering detailed explanations to counter allegations tied to consulting roles, rental income, and Madhabi Puri Buch's ICICI Bank stock options.
Sensex, Nifty end lower as markets take breather after strong rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 135.83 points to 82,926.88, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 43 points lower at 25,345.90.

Bajaj Housing Finance IPO: Cash in on listing day or wait for long-term gain? Brokerages tracking the IPO have already indicated that the IPO is set for a positive listing, with the grey market premium (GMP) indicating that investors will see their money double on listing day.

Sebi chief, husband reject conflict of interest charges, call it false, motivatedIn a joint statement, Sebi chief Madhabi Puri Buch and husband Dhaval Buch rejected recent allegations of conflict of interest as "false, malicious, and defamatory."

Bajaj Finance, Bajaj Finserv shares gain amid housing unit IPO buzzThe buzz around the Bajaj Housing Finance IPO, which is set to make its stock market debut on September 16, has led traders on Dalal Street to snap up shares of other publicly traded Bajaj companies, hoping to capitalise on the momentum.

Western Carriers IPO opens for bidding: Should you subscribe or skip? Western Carriers (India) Limited has allocated 85,96,743 equity shares to 15 anchor investors, raising Rs 148 crore before its proposed IPO.
SpiceJet shares surge 9%: What's fuelling the rally and will it continue?SpiceJet share price: Despite regulatory challenges, the airline's shares have surged recently. Will the rally hold?

PN Gadgil Jewellers IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusPN Gadgil Jewellers IPO allotment: If you've applied for the IPO, you can check the allotment status online in a few simple steps through the websites of the BSE and Bigshare Services.

Bajaj Housing Finance IPO: Got allotment? Check expected listing gainsBrokerages tracking the IPO have already indicated that the IPO is set for a positive listing, with the grey market premium (GMP) indicating that investors will see their money double on listing day.
Adani Group shares drop after Hindenburg's fresh allegationsHindenburg Research claimed that Swiss authorities had frozen over $310 million across several Swiss bank accounts.
Sensex, Nifty pause rally near record highs; Bajaj twins gainThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 134.05 points to 82,828.66 at 10:28 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 44.30 points to 25,344.60.

Adani Group rejects Hindenburg claim of Swiss banks' $310 million funds freezeHindenburg cited a Swiss media outlet, Gotham City, which alleged that more than $310 million belonging to an alleged frontman for billionaire Gautam Adani is sequestered in six Swiss banks. The Adani Group "unequivocally" rejected the claim.

Amazon, Flipkart found violating Indian competition laws: ReportA probe by the Competition Commission of India (CCI) found that e-commerce giants Amazon and Flipkart engaged in anti-competitive practices by favouring select sellers on their platforms.

Understanding circle rates: A simple guide for homebuyers and sellersUnderstanding the concept of circle rates, and how they influence property valuations, has become critical for anyone navigating the real estate market.
Retail inflation rises to 3.65% in August, second lowest in last five yearsRetail inflation rises to 3.65 per cent in August compared to 3.6 per cent in July, as per government data.

India's semiconductor boom: These stocks could be your best pickThe development of the semiconductor value chain—ranging from chip design to manufacturing and assembly, is expected to benefit various companies in the sector.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Protesting doctors on Mamata Banerjee's 'tea' offer: Only if justice is servedOn Saturday evening, despite the chief minister's offer for tea, the protesting doctors vowed to continue their protests until their demand for justice in the rape and murder of the trainee doctor is fulfilled.

Prashant Kishor vows to end Bihar liquor ban 'within an hour' if electedAhead of the launch of his political party, Jan Suraaj, Prashant Kishor pledged to scrap the ban on liquor in Bihar, saying that it led to illegal home deliveries of alcohol and deprived the state of Rs 20,000 crore in excise revenue.

Nitin Gadkari says he was offered support for PM post, he declinedUnion Minister Nitin Gadkari revealed that he once declined an offer from a political leader to support his candidacy for Prime Minister, emphasising that becoming Prime Minister was not his ambition.

Finally, a Mamata masterstroke. But why did it take a month?After 34 days of misreading the agitation and showing her arrogance, Mamata Banerjee reached out to the protesting doctors, not as the West Bengal Chief Minister but as their "didi". But why did the "manush" masterstroke come so late, and how has Mamata won this round?

Is it okay to get married right after ending a long-term relationship?Getting over a breakup is never easy, and diving into a new relationship too quickly can be even riskier. However, much depends on how well a person has processed and healed from the past.

10 killed after three-storey building collapses in Meerut amid rain, 5 rescuedUttar Pradesh Chief Yogi Adityanath took note of the incident and instructed rescue personnel to speed up the relief work.

Chandigarh grenade blast: Punjab Police arrests second accused from DelhiIn a major breakthrough, Punjab Police, with the assistance of central agencies, arrested Vishal Masih, the second accused in the Chandigarh grenade blast case.

CBI arrests ex-RG Kar principal, cop for delay in FIR, missing evidenceSandip Ghosh, ex-RG Kar hospital principal, and Station House Officer Abhijit Mondal were arrested by the CBI for alleged delay in filing the FIR and missing evidence in the rape and murder case.

What is the mood of Kashmir ahead of polls? Watch Rajdeep Sardesai's ground reportAssembly elections will be held in Jammu and Kashmir for the first time in 10 years. This will be the first elections in the Union Territory since Article 370 was scrapped.

Neeraj Chopra finishes 2nd in Diamond League Final behind Anderson PetersIndia's Neeraj Chopra finished second in the Diamond League Final 2024, behind Grenada's Anderson Peters. Neeraj's 87.86m throw came just 0.01m short of Peters' best attempt in Brussels.

Pope urges Catholic voters to choose 'lesser evil' between Trump, Kamala HarrisPope Francis condemned both Kamala Harris and Donald Trump for their positions on some key topics, and labelled them "against life."

Hindu outfits claim mosque in Himachal's Kullu illegal, recite Hanuman ChalisaHindu groups in Himachal Pradesh's Kullu staged a protest outside a decades-old mosque over its alleged illegal construction and recited Hanuman Chalisa.

Haryana polls: Can BJP retain Gurugram amid civic challengesThe Bharatiya Janata Party is facing a significant challenge in retaining Gurugram in the upcoming Haryana polls. Civic issues like traffic congestion and water scarcity are major concerns for residents.

Encounter breaks out between security forces, terrorists in J&K's Poonch The encounter began when the security forces initiated a cordon and search operation based on information about the possibility of terrorists being present in the area.

Younis Khan advises Babar Azam to learn 'major lesson' from Virat KohliFormer Pakistan cricketer Younis Khan wants Babar Azam to learn from Virat Kohli and focus on team's performance instead of retaining his captaincy.

PM Modi to flag off 6 new Vande Bharat trains today during visit to JharkhandAccording to a statement by the Prime Minister's Office (PMO), PM Modi will travel to Jharkhand today and flag off six new Vande Bharat trains at Tatanagar Junction Railway Station at around 10 am.

Neeraj Chopra's solid 2024 despite injury: Olympic silver and three 89+ throwsNeeraj Chopra's 2024 was one that was marred by injury, but the Indian star still went on to produce an Olympic silver and 3 89-plus throws. Neeraj's season came to an end with his second-place finish at the Diamond League final in Brussels on Saturday, September 14.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Singer Chinmayi's 'Harvey Weinstein' jibe at Vairamuthu for Hema Committee remarkChinmayi Sripada called out Tamil lyricist Vairamuthu for suggesting Hema Committee-like panels across the country, calling him the "Tamilian Harvey Weinstein".

Watch: Kiren Rijiju sings Hindi songs with Rajdeep Sardesai at India Today Mind RocksUnion Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju sang Hindi songs during the India Today Mind Rocks Youth Summit on Saturday.

Video: Hindus-Muslims dance together during Ganpati procession in HyderabadIn a display of communal harmony, members of the Hindu and Muslim communities came together to celebrate Ganesh Chaturthi in Hyderabad. A video of Hindu and Muslim participants joyfully dancing together during the Ganesh idol immersion procession has gone viral. Many on the internet commented on the video, saying it sends a message of peace and brotherhood during a time often marked by division.

2 men caught urinating inside Taj Mahal garden, authorities launch probeAuthorities launched a probe and increased security at the Taj Mahal after a viral video showed tourists urinating in its gardens.
Class 3 student dies of heart attack while playing in Lucknow schoolA nine-year-old girl, studying in Class 3, died of a heart attack while she was playing on the premises of her school in Lucknow.

Delhi likely to witness light rain today, alert for showers in Bengal, JharkhandThe India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a rain alert for Jharkhand, Chhattisgarh, West Bengal, eastern Madhya Pradesh and Odisha for today.

GOAT box office Day 10: Thalapathy Vijay's film picks up againThalapathy Vijay's GOAT is nearing the Rs 200 crore mark in India, despite initial fluctuations in box office collections. The film is directed by Venkat Prabhu.

Randeep Hooda-Lin Laishram visit Lalbaugcha Raja, skip VIP accessRandeep Hooda and his wife, Lin Laishram, visited Mumbai's Lalbaugcha Raja Pandal on Friday to seek blessings from Lord Ganesha. In a video, the couple can be seen forgoing their VIP privileges and joining the public for darshan.

Filmmaker Anubhav Sinha on Bheed, Anek's failure: It breaks your heartFilmmaker Anubhav Sinha recently expressed his disappointment over the box office failures of his films Bheed and Anek. He shared that such experiences can certainly discourage a filmmaker from making more movies.

Watch: Jr NTR video calls fan battling cancer, reassures his mother Jr NTR recently video-called a 19-year-old fan battling blood cancer and offered words of encouragement. A video of the interaction has gone viral on social media.

sports.headline: PCB removes daily allowance of women cricketers in national campsThe Pakistan Cricket Board has decided to stop daily allowances for women players in national camps, citing provision of accommodation and meals. The move has sparked disappointment amongst players, especially as male counterparts receive allowances.

Messi marks injury return with two goals in Miami's 3-1 win vs UnionLionel Messi made a significant return from injury, scoring two goals and delivering an assist in Inter Miami's 3-1 victory over the Philadelphia Union on Saturday night.

Chelsea beat Bournemouth, set record for most yellow cards in Premier League Chelsea's substitute Christopher Nkunku scored the decisive goal in the 86th minute, sealing a 1-0 victory over Bournemouth in a match that saw a record 14 yellow cards. Despite Bournemouth's pressure and missed opportunities, Chelsea managed to come out on top.

Cautious Mohammed Shami not looking to rush himself back into actionStar India fast bowler has revealed that he isn't looking to rush himself back into action ahead of the packed Test season. Shami has been sidelined since the ODI World Cup 2023 due to an ankle injury.

Travis Head reveals India not his favourite opponent: 'They are difficult'Australia batter Travis Head has said that India is not his favourite opponent to play against. Head did well against Rohit Sharma's team in the 2023 season, hitting 2 centuries in the WTC and World Cup Final.

ISL: Hometown hero Vinith Venkatesh nets winner as Bengaluru FC beat East BengalHometown boy Vinith Venkatesh was the star of the show as Bengaluru FC started their ISL 2024-25 campaign with a 1-0 win over East Bengal on Saturday, September 14.

BAN govt rewards cricket team with BDT 3.2 crore for series win vs PakistanBangladesh government announced a mega-cash reward for their men's cricket team on Saturday, September 14. The government handed the side Rs 3.20 crore Bangladesh Taka to the national team for their historic Test series win against Pakistan.

Diamond League Final Highlights: Neeraj finishes 2nd, misses Diamond Trophy by 0.01 mNeeraj Chopra Highlights at Diamond League final: India's Neeraj Chopra finished second in the Diamond League Final on Saturday, September 14, behind Paris Olympics bronze medallist Anderson Peters in the men's javelin competition. Competing at the King Baudouin Stadium in Brussels, Neeraj's best attempt was 87.86 meters, just one centimetre behind Peters. Peters won the prestigious Diamond Trophy, announcing his return to form in the 2024 season.

Premier League: Liverpool lose to Forest at Anfield for first time in 55 yearsLiverpool fell to a 0-1 loss against Nottingham Forest at the Anfield on Saturday, September 14. This was the first time in 55 years that the hosts lost a game to Forest at home.

Was surprised to see Babar Azam become Pakistan captain again: Imad WasimImad Wasim admitted that he was surprised to see Babar Azam being given the captaincy of the Pakistan white-ball teams after a short break of 6 months ahead of the T20 World Cup. Babar had stepped down as captain after the ODI World Cup 2023.

Watch: Virat Kohli hits trademark pull shot in trainingSenior India batter Virat Kohli looked in prime touch ahead of the 1st Test match against Bangladesh. Kohli pulled off a stunning pull shot in the practice session on Saturday.

De Ligt credits Onana's penalty save behind Man United's win over SouthamptonPremier League: Manchester United defender Matthijs de Ligt credited goalkeeper Andre Onana for turning the tide against Southampton on Saturday. United registered 3 goals after Onana's penalty save in the 34th minute of the game.

Manchester United boss Erik ten Hag praises Marcus Rashford after Southampton winManchester United boss heaped praise on Marcus Rashford after the England forward broke his 13-game goal drought during the win over Southampton on Saturday, September 14.

ISL: Farukh, Chima on target as Chennaiyin start campaign with 3-2 win over OdishaChennaiyin FC broke Odisha FC's 569-day-long unbeaten home streak in a come-from-behind victory in the Indian Super League on Saturday, September 14. Chennaiyin beat Odisha 3-2 with Farukh Choudhary scoring a brace.

Marcus Rashford ends 13-game drought as Manchester United beat Southampton 3-0Manchester United returned to winning ways as Marcus Rashford and Matthijs de Ligt were amongst the goalscorers as they beat Southampton  3-0 on Saturday, September 14.

Virat Kohli fan shares kind gesture by star batter during practice in ChepaukVirat Kohli's humble gesture of obliging for pictures with fans and a chat has been winning hearts online, once again showcasing his deep connection with fans while preparing for the upcoming Bangladesh Test series.

Asian Champions Trophy: Semi-finals confirmed as China defeat Japan 2-0China defeated Japan 2-0 to book their spot in the semifinals in the Asian Champions Trophy 2024 on Saturday, September 14. India will now play Korea in the semifinal while Pakistan will face China in the other one.

Tottenham Hotspur vs Arsenal: H2H, all you need to know about North London derbyTottenham Hotspur will welcome Arsenal to the Tottenham Hotspur stadium for this season's first instalment of the North London derby on September 15, Sunday.

Fittest cricketer in India? Bumrah's reply divides fans on social mediaIndia fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah's reply to the question, 'who is the fittest cricketer from India' has landed him in hot water. A section of India's cricketing fan base has called out Bumrah for being arrogant.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
